title: Violent Incident at Welsh School: Student Charged with Assault
summary: A 15-year-old student at Milford Haven Comprehensive School in Pembrokeshire, Wales, has been charged with grievous bodily harm and possession of a bladed weapon after allegedly assaulting a teacher. The incident occurred on Thursday afternoon, prompting Dyfed-Powys Police to respond to reports of an attack involving a weapon. The teacher sustained stab wounds and was hospitalized but has since been discharged and is recovering. The teenager is in police custody and is scheduled to appear at Swansea Magistrates' Court. In response, the school closed on Friday, cancelling all events, though it remained available for support. Police increased their presence in the area to reassure the community. Welsh First Minister Eluned Morgan and NASUWT teachers' union general secretary Matt Wrack condemned the violence, emphasizing that schools should be safe environments for education. This case highlights ongoing concerns about school safety and the impact of such incidents on students, staff, and the wider community.
